intro: Scorzonera tenorei, commonly known as the Tuscan scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Scorzonera tenorei has a taproot that is sometimes used in traditional medicine. It is relatively rare and has a restricted geographic distribution.
